text: today I'm going to share with you one of
my favorite go-to
sort of fancy but super easy desserts
the puff pastry tart filled with whipped
cream and fresh berries so good so easy
and straight out of your freezer case
yeah baby the first thing you want to do
is buy some puff pastry usually comes in
a pound the great thing about these is
that they're super impressive because
puff pastry is so cool-looking but
they're actually really really easy I
just like to unfold my sheets directly
onto parchment lined baking sheets and
then if any edges have gotten a little
bit wonky or misshapen you can trim them
so that they're square and then cut each
sheet into four squares
I mean squares is a relative term and
then score a border about three quarters
of an inch from the edge using the tip
of a paring knife just cut about halfway
through the dough don't go all the way
through the pastry take your egg wash
and brush the edges this will make it
nice and golden while it's baking you
don't want the egg to drip down over the
edges because that could prevent it from
puffing up while it's baking and then
sprinkle the edges with sugar be as
generous as you like this is going to
add Sparkle enos and flavor these need
to chill in the freezer for about ten
minutes before you pop them into a 400
degree oven and baking for about 10 to
15 minutes my tarts are out of the oven
and cooling and I'm getting my filling
ready you're gonna need about three cups
of sliced fruit I'm using strawberries
today you could also use apricot mango
cherries anything that's in season add a
couple tablespoons of sugar or even
honey if you'd like honey's really great
with apricots and mangoes it's a little
overwhelming for strawberries so I
wouldn't use it there and then I like to
add a little bit of acidity to my fruit
mixture so I'm adding a tiny bit of
balsamic vinegar which is great with
strawberries lemon juice is more common
you can always go with lemon juice it's
good with everything or even lime juice
pinch of salt I always like to add a
pinch of salt to all of my sweet
mixtures because it enhances flavor as
does acidity little acid little salt
little sugar it's a great combination
with fruit then you want to let it sit
just so that the juice
we'll come out of the berries or other
fruit and that all the sugar will
dissolve while you're waiting for your
fruit to macerate you can finish up by
pressing down the Centers of your tarts
as they bake the whole thing pops up but
where you scored the border you can just
press it down and that'll give you a
room for your fruit in your cream I have
a little bit of lightly sweetened
whipped cream here just gonna finish it
off a little bit I don't like it to be
too too stiff I guess you can use the
can too if you want it too I won't tell
that looks good to me I'm excited to try
this so I'm gonna plate one up right now
take one cook tart spoon some cream into
the center some of that delicious fruit
on top make sure you get a little bit of
the the juices that have come out of the
fruit and you have a fantastic dessert
in practically no time sober so easy and
so impressive but for company but for
friends fit for family fit for you treat
yourself today
you
